title: Qandisa
extract:
[[Category:{{{topic}}} articles needing translation from German Wikipedia]]

Qandisa (Qandiša) is a female Jinn figure in Northern Moroccan folklore. Probably the former goddess of lust Astarte, but degraded, by Islamic influence, to a demon, she is believed to live in springs and rivers and seduces young men to fell in love with her, causing possession or impotence. On the summer solstice, some people still sacrifice to her.
